content.description: Two starts (left one might be 5.7; right maybe 5.6); Righthand start is 20' left of Frogger and follows obvious white protuding dike.  Left is just straight up.  Either way, climb to vertical section in darker rock (crux).
content.protection:
Trad rack (extra 1-2"?)

One bolt at top for anchor (supplement with cams/nuts)

content.description: This OW crack is in an alcove around the corner from "Coyote's Carelessness" arete. Yes, this is an off-width climb.
content.protection: A couple of 5-inch or 4.5-inch big cams are nice
content.location: On the upper third rock tier above the main Murphy Creek area. Spectacular views of the main Sierra crest.

content.description: Short little seam crack on the far left side of the cliff
Up vertical hand-and-finger crack to downward-pointing roof, up and over to rewarding offwidth, veering left at top to bolted rap anchor.
25' left of X-Wing; basically, the vertical double crack system; goes through a wider pod about halfway (it is NOT the left-leaning wide crack just to the left)
perhaps doable without mandatory OW moves, but the heal-toe jams are decent enough.
Clean, left-leaning dihedral.  Direct start (11b) goes up corner on right through a wide section with poor feet and joins the regular route at white ramp.   Continue up corner (10c)
content.protection: Cold shut & bolt with link at top
content.location: about 20' left of Penguin Cafe (obvious splitter handcrack)

content.description:
Shared anchors with Mandric Direct and Auto Bond.

Climb the ramp to the left facing corner and move through the roof.  A directional is recommended to reduce swings.

I did not lead this route but you'll need a range of small finger sized gear to a #3.  I suspect doubles at #.75 and #1 will be useful.
content.location: Ramp between Auto Bond and Mandric Direct.

content.description: Climb up the outside of a spectacular arete past one bolt (crux) to a big jug. Scamper up easier territory to the summit.
content.protection: Draws and a few cams and stoppers to 2.5"
content.location: "Lock, Stock, and Barrel" is on the east face of the highest rock tier above the main Murphy Creek cliff. Right around the corner from "Whips & Chains"

content.description: Thin crack up the center of the second tier above the main Murphy Creek wall. Crux on first crack. Second easier crux at the end off a small ledge.
content.location: From on top of Murphy Creek main wall walk back and up until you encounter the second tier. Seems to be some undocumented slab routes up here too.

content.description:
Toprope near the left edge of Guppie Wall (just right of a high point in the ramp/ledge)

Reachy face to crack/seam that begins in little roof ~10' off the deck.

Crack is flared and bottoms out
content.protection: One coldshut at the top; supplement with cam & long sling

content.description:
An OW-sized crack that demands very little actual OW technique, this climb boasts a surprising amount of hand jams and much wide stuff can be circumnavigated with stemming and face holds. Cheating, I know.

Large blocks are split on either side by essentially two cracks, so choose your path according to your strengths, but you should probably wind up by finishing on the crack on the right side because the anchors are located there.
content.protection: Hand sized to 5" camalot. Widely spaced rap anchors.
content.location: In the chimney just right of the distinctive Penguin Cafe. Obvious wide cracks.

content.description:
Sustained double fist crack on quailty granite.

The name says it all, its like playing leep frog up the crack.
content.protection: Requires lots of large gear to 5". also requires gear for belay.
content.location: Right side of the cliff band there is a fun looking double crack system that widens as it goes up. Thats it!

content.description: This route climbs the left leaning fingers to hands then back to fingers crack with a bouldery sequence up higher.  Expect a little bit of munge if climbing this early season.  The anchor is one rusty 5/16 button with an SMC hanger,  back it up with directionals or bring a bolt kit and slam in a new anchor.
content.protection: Doubles from black totem to .75, and single #3
content.location: This route starts left of Auto Bond at a grassy stance.  It’s probably a good idea to build a little anchor for your belayer.
